answers.answer: congratulations...you now have a conclusive test result for your NO risk situation.  time to put this behind you and move on with your life.

Steroids, antibiotics and diabetes are some other causes if you do indeed have oral candidiasis.  Better have a doc check you out to first confirm what it is and secondly find the cause; it's not likely to be HIV with a neg test at 86 days.
You never had a risk of contracting HIV and you've tested with conclusive negative tests.

Should I test again since it wasn't a full 90 days? I've been dealing with a weird ear problem for the last 2 weeks and now I'm freaking out again.I tried to get the chick to test so I can really stop worrying,but she won't do it.Not even for $400!
You are conclusively negative.
I believe you but I still have these "what if" scenarios from time to time.Even if she had AIDS,I still didn't have a risk?
You didn't have a risk to begin with and after 46 posts you still have "what ifs." I suggest you seek professional mental help to deal with your issues.
Even if I had a real risk,would 84-86 days be good enough?
Also,I made a mistake and got one of the numbers in my social security wrong when filling out the form,would this somehow get my test mixed up with someone else's?
NO and NO.
84 - 86 days isn't enough time to test? I should of waited longer?
You have a conclusive test result for a NO RISK situation.
I just want to know that if it was a real risk,would a test at 84 to 86 days be conclusive?
You've been here long enough to know. 12 weeks is conclusive and again you didn't have a risk. End of discussion.
Thanks Teak.It's time for me to move on(again). I really appreciate your patients with me.
Last questionI was just looking over my results papers and on the first one it says Report 1/1but on the second one it says Report 5/5What does this mean?
move on ! ! !
I just want to know if it is anything to worry about?
NO
Is Orasure oral fluid test reliable?

question: A little over a week ago I received a negative test at 86 days,but I still have oral thrush.Are my results reliable or should I have waited 90 days?
title: 86 day negative but still experiencing symptoms
